meanings.sent1: Using a knife on hard surfaces often dulls its blade.
meanings.sent2: The constant friction slowly dulls the edge of the scissors.
meanings.sent3: The pencil sharpener decided to go on strike, claiming it was tired of dulling all the pencils.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous routine of daily life dulls the sharpness of our minds.
meanings.sent5: The relentless sun beating down on the sign eventually dulls its colors to a pale shade.

meanings.definition: Make or become less intense, vivid, or interesting.
meanings.sent1: Watching TV for hours on end dulls the excitement of the show.
meanings.sent2: The repeated use of the same joke dulls its humor over time.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was so predictable that it only dulled the audience's interest.
meanings.sent4: The constant rain dulls the vibrant colors of the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The monotonous sound of the clock ticking slowly dulls the atmosphere in the room.
